review_title: Great pay and benefits but HR needs an overhaul

cons: the tension between staff and management and between professional services and academics - makes it a sometimes stressful working environment

pros: Solid international reputation, but UK higher Ed is a mess.
cons: Unstable financial outlook. Serious troubles between academics and senior management.

pros: Good pension, good work-life balance
cons: Institution stuck in the past, crippled decision-making, lack of inspiring leadership

pros: The location is great that's all.
cons: Very isolate place. Not welcoming, feel as thought I am a stranger and is there many months. Nobody speak to each other. It's hard to make friends, this university doesn't live up to it's name. This seem to be a cruel experiment. There is no inclusivity just isolation on a major scale. A friendless university with less compassionate staff.

pros: Fantastic staff and good location
cons: Extra hours unpaid and difficult to even get paid for scheduled work. HR team firmly on side of management - no confidentiality. Lack of diversity in senior roles. Snobbish attitude towards non-academics or people without a PhD.

pros: Good central located friendly staff
cons: High living cost low paid stressful

pros: Most colleagues are focussed on improvement, work hard and are generally good people to work and engage with. There are of course some outliers.
cons:
The problem is years of redundancies, restructures and some resistance to change. 
SOAS needs to improve their IT systems drastically so that those of us who want to improve things, have the software to do so

pros: Small community and very good students.

pros: We got paid on time (because the payroll officer works all the hours God sends)
cons:
Awful people and the worse management
Gossipy and rude.
No appreciation
No progression
People at the bottom work late nights and weekends and management just want the work done regardless if you sleep or not.
If you are not favoured by the director, you will not climb ladder. 
Way too much office politics for such a small team

review_title: High Turnover of Staff says it all!
pros:
Good opportunities for academic staff
Nice people 
Generous leave
Central location with good transport links
cons:
Everyone is overworked - get the job done at any cost
Silo working - no promotion of teamworking
Old systems and no training provided for new staff
Lack of management support and empathy from some managers
Chaotic & disorganised - policies so out of date

pros: Students are the best you will ever meet

review_title: Not a great place to work for.
pros:
Flexible working hours
A great line manager
Friendly team
You can get the experience you need in the Higher Education sector
Low salary compared to other universities
cons:
Lack of professional development resources and career development accredited courses.
Staff shortage in some administrative areas that lead to staff providing bad student experience. Senior management is aware of this but their inability to take immediate action shows that they do not care.
Staff cuts - senior management are happy to create more roles in their grade and cut roles in lower grades, creating unmanageable workloads for staff members who already do so much to keep the school running. You can sometimes feel undervalued as an employee of the university.
Depressing company culture.

pros: world known uni degree gives you opportunity
cons: too far in london, bad adminstration

pros: The people were interesting and overall very collegial. The work place is culturally vibrant and diversity is celebrated.
cons: The company is very disorganised. There is little accountability for managers, and this affects junior staff negatively. There are no effective systems for evaluating outcomes or setting clear goals.

pros:
Small, friendly campus
Mix of interesting programmes and some great events 
Very diverse staff and student body
If you get in a good team with a good line manager, it's a fantastic place to work. It's also what you make of it, so take up any opportunities you hear about and don't let the negative people bring you down!
cons:
Some staff have been here for years, coasting along, and are reluctant to take on any new responsibilities. Trade Unions have too much power, leaving a significant portion on line managers unable or unwilling to challenge underperforming individuals. Some people claim to be miserable but have been here for over a decade so it can't be that bad!
Some people end up with very heavy workloads and seem unable to raise it as an issue.

pros:
It's like owning an Italian sports car - you can easily fall in love with it, and nobody is ever indifferent.
The world's finest minds and mot infuriating administration, all under one roof.
cons: I wouldn't say there are "cons." Just "character."

pros: Meet different people from many various cultures and backgrounds.
cons: Short of staff and no pension scheme
